name: Grand Bohemian Hotel Orlando, Autograph Collection

reviews.title: No service present at this hotel - Never ever again
reviews.text: Stayed at this hotel for 4 nights and it seems like service was never present at this hotel. Wherever you go you have to wait forever until anybody takes care of you. To get a drink and a simple snack in the lounge it took us at two occasions at least 30 minutes until we were serviced.

reviews.title: Very nice experience
reviews.text: Pool was closed almost every evening due to private events and even if there was time to use it, there were no chairs available because they only have 10 chairs for the whole hotel.

Rooms weren't cleaned until 5pm in the evening and bath amenities like shower gel and soap wasn't refilled once during the whole stay. Although our room was 5 rooms away from the elevator we heard the elevator noise all night. We even heard the TV of our neighbor room.
reviews.title: Avoid Avoid Avoid

reviews.text: Breakfast in the restaurant was the slowest breakfast service I ever experienced, it took us 1 hr from arriving at the restaurant to staring to eat.
reviews.title: Noisy!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The good:
reviews.title: Good and Bad

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 1. Great location near tons of restaurants/bars (Church St, Wall St Plaza, the lake, etc) and Amway Center
reviews.title: Cool, Funky and Great Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 2. Very cool and trendy - great bar and interesting artwork throughout the hotel
reviews.title: Feeling at Home at the Grand Bohemian

reviews.text: 3. Awesome room with great furniture/bed - and loved the double shower head in bathroom :-)
reviews.title: My Kind of Hotel

reviews.text: The bad:
reviews.title: Most enjoyable!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Me and my wife stayed at The Grand Bohemian as our first stop on our Honeymoon. Check in went smoothly. Nice staff!! We had a deluxe Room with a king Bed with nice view of the fantastic Pool terrace. Just terrific. Nice champagne arrived to our room just minutes after check in. But prepare to give 30-50 dollar.
reviews.title: Amazing Grand Bohemian

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We loved the nice lounge and Boheme Restaurant .
reviews.title: The Grand Bohemian is tres chic!

likes.disliked: — Comforter was not down - it was lumpy and polyester

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Every single night they had live Jazz with superb artist.
reviews.title: This is NO 5 Star Hotel...it's not even a 3!

likes.disliked: — Non-accommodation in restaurant when wearing polo shirt and khaki shorts.

reviews.text: We enjoyed every evening we had here. Try the Cheese platter with some nice white wine. It is excellent.
reviews.title: I plan to be a regular

reviews.text: Hotel is located on a really nice and walkable street in downtown Orlando. We love this hotel!! We also enjoyed the Swan boats ride in Lake Eola located just 10 minute walk or less from Grand Bohemian.
reviews.title: great for adults, romance, business travelers., and a popular nightspot

reviews.text: I stayed here on business for 2 weeks. The room is quite nice with a comfortable chaise lounge where I could watch TV and do my work. It was clean and upscale.
reviews.title: Nice place to stay

reviews.text: I was a little disappointed since I am a Marriott frequent sleeper and didn't get the amenities that are on my profile. When I asked the hotel manager about this, she pretty much shrugged me off. My colleague was put on the Concierge floor since we were there for so long - I wasn't.
reviews.title: Great Hotel, Great Location

reviews.text: Overall, the hotel was nice. Kind of a harlequin theme going - kind of dark - but nice. The bar is very nice and the restaurant brunch was quite good. The bartenders were the best - Chelsea and Ivy. Worth going there just to be recognized and treated like someone special. The front desk was pleasant, but never went out of their way to say hello. The valets were very good - quick and polite. Be careful of the mini-bar. OVERLY sensitive. I just opened it in the middle of the night looking for water and got charged for a $30 bottle of champagne. In all fairness, they did remove the charge.
reviews.title: Clean, hip hotel in downtown

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I will definitely stay here again the next time I have to return to this office.
reviews.title: Excellent

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Super fun experience here. The location was great, bed was comfy, staff was accomodating. The only weird thing I noticed was that the lighting in the room is so low! Had access to the club room for breakfast which was delicious!!!
reviews.title: Amazing experience!

reviews.text: I arrived late (after midnight) without my bags (lost by airline) and was greeted warmly by the evening clerk. When he noticed I did not have bags he offered complimentary toiletry items, which I accepted. The room was larger than I expected and the bed VERY comfortable. The room and bathroom were extremely clean and tidy. I was impressed most by two things that I haven't seen before in my relatively limited travels - dual wake up calls and a dual head shower head. I didn't want to get out of bed on the first call, and I knew I had a second call coming, so I went back to sleep and caught another 15 minutes sleep. Then I didn't want to get out of the shower.
reviews.title: Very Nice Hotel
Not Grand and Not Bohemian
reviews.text: I was only in the hotel about 8 1/2 hours, but I enjoyed my stay very much and will stay there again when in Orlando next.

reviews.title: At Your Service
reviews.text: This hotel is fine, but nowhere near the level I expected. First the positives. If you want something in downtown Orlando, the location is good. The pool area is very nice with a "tent" seating area. Now the bad news. The valet parking area is very small and crowded. It's often mass chaos/congestion out there. The lobby is small, and the front desk service was mediocre (everyone seems pretty aloof). The rooms are very normal and average. For this level hotel, I expected more. The closets are tiny and the bathroom is just a single sink, tub/shower combo, and no toilet closet. Okay, this really doesn't matter in the big scheme of things, but it bothered me -- the paint job was very poorly done. There was paint all over the towel hooks and even onto the bath tile. Also the on demand movie system wasn't working. My two biggest complaints. It was very noisey -- the room didn't insulate against noise in the halway and from neighboring rooms. Lastly, there was inebriate people out front and in the very small lobby. Overall disappointing for this level hotel.
I was caught in a Florida rain shower while running in Downtown Orlando from the Grand Bohemian. When I returned to the Hotel, I was a rain-soaked mess.
reviews.title: Need a place for your meeting? This is it!!!

reviews.text: I stopped by the valet desk and asked for a towel, so I wouldn't leave a trail of rain water through the lobby.
reviews.title: Great Experience at the Grand Bohemian

likes.liked: — Nicely appointed, luxury-style hotel with excellent customer service.
likes.disliked: — Downtown location is too far from the tourist sites of Disney, etc., so the main draw is for business travelers in Orlando itself.

reviews.text: My overnight stay was 9/5/07 for Business. I was excited to get a chance to stay at such a beautiful property & I was not disappointed! It's perfect for the business trip. However, it's also excellent for a Romantic Getaway! The room, decor & the nightlife is awesome! The lobby, outside by the valet & in your room you were surrounded by soothing Jazz/Bohemian style music. I even had the chance to buy a copy of the CD offered in every room (great souvenir!). I stayed on the 14th floor & had no problem with noise; not even with the Construction going on a few doors down in the newly renovated Suites. During the day you can catch the Free Bus called 'Lymmo' right outside the the Hotel & can get a quick tour of Downtown. No need for a car rental (save the money for a Spa Treatment at the hotel). The "Lymmo" goes to the Bus Depot & you can get all the regular "Lynx" Buses to go to places like all the Parks, Mall & even the Airport. I will be back for PLEASURE next time!
reviews.title: Artistic Splendor!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Boy, where do I start. I guess I will begin by saying that we were really looking forward to staying at the Grand Bohemian. Being from Florida, and visiting Orlando many times, I have heard such great things about this hotel. Being a frequent vistor of trip advisor, I was aware of the parking, internet charges...but not the nickel and diming for everything. First off, couldnt find street parking, so we had to fork over $21.25 a day for parking. How ridiculous, it should be FREE when staying at the hotel. It costs $11 a day to have internet access, all the food in the room is ridiculously overpirced. We are a younger couple (late 20's), and are not picky at all. We appreciate the little things and like to have a good stay when forking over some heavy money for a hotel room. Upon arriving for check in, we given are keys and not told about the location of the pool, spa services, gym, etc. No mention of anything- heres your key, have a nice stay. We get to our room, two queen beds. Of course we booked a king. Call down to the front desk and they tell us there are no kings left. Great start, no mention of this when checking in, so you can imagine my frustration already. They come up with a plan and tell us there is one king available, but it is handicap. I give them the ok just as long as we are switched the next day. Enough with my story, let me tell you about the hotel. The hotel is very nice and the rooms are quite honestly, nothing spectacular. Nothing better than, say a Embassy Suites. However, the bar and pool are fantastic. I would describe the hotel as a gothic, artsy setting. The location is fantastic if you will be hitting up the bars on orange ave and church st. I will quickly summarize the problems.
reviews.title: Honest Review by younger couple- 2.5
Great wedding night!
reviews.text: 1. Given handicap room, so shower was the same level as the bathroom floor. There was a flood like a damn levee broke every time we took a shower.
2. The shower had no hot water, with the exception of one time. What ajoke that was.
reviews.title: Grand Stay at the Grand Bohemian

likes.liked: — Classy, professional, pleasant and attentive service
likes.disliked: — Compulsory valet ok but charge was a little high

reviews.text: 3. No fan in the bathroom (are you serious, yes I am). So if you frequent the bathroom like I do, your traveling companion will smell your stinky booty for an hour.
reviews.title: Excellent experience...luxury in Orlando!

reviews.text: The Grand Bohemian, formerly managed by Westin and now part of the Kessler Group, is still the best hotel, by a long shot, in downtown Orlando, and Kessler seems to have done a nice job freshening the decor. As a classic luxury hotel in a grand older building, the Bohemian is a welcome exception to the cookie-cutter business hotels in town, and a far different experience from the numerous resort and vacation properties in the outer Orlando sprawl. Although the small lobby is decked out in bold colors and features bright contemporary artwork, both for show and sale, at heart, the Grand Bohemian is a serious, old-style city-center business hotel, and if you are in town on business, or just plain sick of resort hotels full of loud and sunburned hordes in t-shirts and flip-flops, there's no better place to stay. This is decidedly not an Orlando fun, sun and boat drinks sort of place: the staid ambience feels far more of Chicago or Philadelphia than anything remotely Floridian.
reviews.title: The Best in Downtown Orlando

likes.disliked: — The "convenience" $6.75 bottle of water in the room.

reviews.text: The Bohemian's rooms are very large, comfortable, and very attractively furnished and decorated. The air conditioning - - all important in Orlando's swampy climate - - is strong, efficient and blessedly quiet. Beds and bedding are first rate. The work-out room is nothing special, but the pool, on a 6th floor outdoor terrace, is beautiful and pure bliss. For runners not afraid of serious humidity, the pathways around Lake Eola, just a couple blocks from the hotel, are exceptionally pretty jogging grounds.
reviews.title: Great Hotel, Great Price

reviews.text: Hotel staff are mostly well trained, eager and helpful. The parking valets were quick to offer cold, bottled water when I returned from a run, and also quick to retrieve my car when needed. The concierge is very helpful. The front desk had a little trouble retrieving my reservation from the hotel's web-site, but recovered quickly and professionally.
reviews.title: Grand Bohemian Not Worth the Expense

reviews.text: As others have noted, downtown Orlando is something of a work in progress, but there are plenty of nearby places to eat and drink. If you want a splurge, the hotel's restaurant, Boheme, is a beautiful and romantic spot, with very good food and a creative wine list (including good excellent offerings by the glass).
reviews.title: Still the best

reviews.text: I stayed at the Grand Bohemian for 3 nights in July. Right from the start it was a very pleasant experience. The staff is friendly, professional and helpful.
reviews.title: Not All Its Cracked Up to Be, Plus Hidden Charge$

reviews.text: I visited this hotel over the weekend for a business trip. I live in Miami and I guess you could say I'm a bit of a hotel snob.I appreciate five star hotels and usually try to find one when I travel, either for business or pleasure. That being said, I also used to be an Orlando native and I'm very familiar with the hotel scene there.
reviews.title: Artsy and Cute, Needs Some Updates...

reviews.text: Unfortunately, downtown Orlando doesn't provide much of a selection for 5-star hotels. The true luxury properties like the Ritz Carlton, Waldorf, or Gaylord Palms are down South in the attractions area, and I needed to be downtown for this particular trip. The Grand Bohemian is pretty much it for "luxury (ish)" downtown.
reviews.title: Enjoyed more than a Disney Hotel

reviews.text: Priced just slightly under the other 5 star properties in Orlando, but also priced significantly more than Embassy Suites and The Sheraton...it's kind of in a league of its own. But nonetheless, I was excited to check it out and see just how trendy Orlando could possibly be.
reviews.title: Super hotel

reviews.text: The lobby is the best part, the location is also perfect. Very central walking distance to great restaurants and bars in downtown. I really enjoyed the lounge and live music at night.
reviews.title: the place to saty downtown

reviews.text: The rooms definitely need an update in a big way. Everything is very dark - and the old lamps have got to go. They boast a chic lobby, but the old appearance of the furniture, lighting, and bathroom just don't fit. You would expect a trendy hotel to have the sleekest and cleanest bathrooms, an Ipod dock in the rooms (please remove the 1995 CD players), and some lighting that allows you to see while you're getting ready. I read some good reviews about the beds - but honestly, nowadays, all the boutique trendy properties have stepped it up a notch with cool things like a pillow menu, better linens, and a better TV.
reviews.title: Awesome boutique hotel
